revised_title: Observation of the Winter Solstice of 1812 and the Mural Circle at Greenwich
tldr: John Pond, Astronomer Royal, observed the winter solstice of 1812 using the Mural Circle at Greenwich. Due to unfavorable weather, only eight observations of the sun were obtained. The obliquity of the ecliptic at the late solstice was inferred to be 230° 27' 471.35". The small discordance with the summer solstice could be resolved by modifying Bradley's refractions, but further observations are needed before making any corrections.
